nio/Twitter Search.Description: A block that searches Twitter statuses.
nio/Twitter Search.Output:
The following is an example of the output signals notified from the block after the Twitter API is searched with the configurable criteria. Note that there may be more attributes output than what is listed below, and not all of the listed attributes are guaranteed to be included on every signal.
```
{
statuses: [
{
coordinates: string
favorited: boolean,
created_at: datetime,
text: string,
metadata: {
iso_language_code: string,
result_type: string
},
retweet_count: int,
geo: null,
retweeted: boolean,
user: {
name: string,
profile_image_url: string,
created_at: string,
location: string,
id: int,
followers_count: int,
protected: boolean,
geo_enabled: boolean,
description: string,
statuses_count: int,
friends_count: int,
},
},
...
],
}
```

count.description: maximum tweets to notify from search results

lookback.description: how far to look back for tweets

result_type.description: choose between `POPULAR`, `RECENT` or `MIXED` to specify what types of tweets to notify from search

longitude.description: longitude for location to search for tweets

latitude.description: latitude for location to search for tweets

hashtags.description: hashtags to search for in tweets

at.description: list of users who were referenced in tweets using `@` character

tweet_text.description: keywords to search for in tweets

radius.description: how far from `latitude` and `longitude` position to search for tweets

tude.description: choose from `NEUTRAL`, `QUESTION`, `NEGATIVE` and `POSITIVE` to specify the tone of the tweets that should be notified from block

interval.description: how often the API is polled
